content.question: Which of the following is an example of civil society changing in the United Kingdom?

choices.label: Tony Blair seized the middle ground ofÂ British politics and moved the United Kingdom toward centrism.
Trade unions became less influential with fewer resources after Thatcherism.
Devolution created new regional parties, and people left the two main political parties.
Several hereditary seats were eliminated after a reform to the House of Lords.

content.answer: Trade unions became less influential with fewer resources after Thatcherism.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Explain how political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors apply in a course country.
